modules.description: This module provides operations to control media player behavior, including quitting, raising the player interface, and querying capabilities like track list support. It works with `OBus_proxy.t` to interact with media players over D-Bus, exposing properties such as identity, desktop entry, and supported URI schemes or MIME types. Concrete use cases include integrating with desktop environments to manage playback applications like Spotify or VLC through standardized MPRIS interfaces.

Creates a D-Bus proxy for interacting with the Banshee media player. Works with `OBus_proxy.t` to enable communication over D-Bus. Useful for controlling Banshee playback and querying track information from OCaml applications.

This module creates D-Bus proxies for interacting with Spotify via the MPRIS interface, enabling control over playback and metadata retrieval. It includes a submodule implementing the `org.mpris.MediaPlayer2` interface, supporting operations like play, pause, and track information queries. Users can integrate with desktop environments to manage Spotify, query playback status, or retrieve track metadata using D-Bus proxies. The module also exposes player properties such as identity, supported URIs, and capabilities like track list support.
Creates an OBus proxy for interacting with a MPRIS-compliant media player, specifically Mopidy. Use this to control playback, access metadata, and manage playlists through the MPRIS D-Bus interface.

Creates an OBus proxy for a given service name, enabling interaction with MPRIS-compliant media players over D-Bus. Works with strings representing service names and returns lightweight threads (Lwt) for asynchronous communication. Useful for building clients that control or monitor media playback through D-Bus interfaces.
